channel.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver
channel.description: Posts from Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

item.title: After eight long grueling days in jail, our comrades Lillian and...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

After eight long grueling days in jail, our comrades Lillian and Eliza, one of whom still has a warrant out for her arrest in Arapahoe county, came out to our march to demand that the charges be dropped against all the arrested anti-racist organizers. These two comrades showed immense bravery in coming and speaking out against the injustice and cruelty of the criminal justice system, which they‚Äôve now experienced firsthand. Joel would have absolutely been there too if he didn...'t have to be out of town!

Despite the incredibly difficult experience of going through jail and the facing the upcoming battle to drop the over 30 serious charges that these organizers collectively face, they have not been intimidated by the repressive and violent forces of DPD, APD, and the 18th and 17th district attorneys. Their resolve has only been made stronger against the injustice that they and all prisoners and victims of police violence face.

Lillian spoke about the meaning of solidarity, telling the crowd how Eliza told her lawyer that if bond was posted for her before Lillian, she would insist on staying in jail despite the horrible torturous conditions she faced until Lillian was released too.

Eliza spoke of the need to continue the struggle against police terror now more than ever, saying "Let it be known - they wouldn't come after us if this movement didn't SCARE them!"

The battle to drop the charges is only beginning and everyone in the movement must come together in solidarity at this time to challenge an enemy with more resources but not more numbers, an enemy that uses the power of violence but is no match for the power of the people!

In the words of Assata Shakur: ‚ÄúWe must love and support one another‚Äù

And in the words of Lillian House: ‚ÄúOur determination is so much greater than our fear. Our solidarity is so much greater than the repression. I have never felt more confident that we have what it takes to go the distance. WE WILL WIN"

See More+4
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Lillian House speaks just two days after she, Joel, and Eliza...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Lillian House speaks just two days after she, Joel, and Eliza were released after being held for 8 days in jail.

"They‚Äôve never seen a movement like this before. They miscalculated when they came for us! Because we are not weaker ‚Äî we are stronger now! We will not be silenced!"

#DropTheChargesCO

Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Lillian House, one of the activists who was held in jail for 8 days, speaks at the Denver state house yesterday. Why are we facing this repression?

"They‚Äôve nev...er seen a movement like this before. They miscalculated when they came for us! Because we are not weaker ‚Äî we are stronger now! We will not be silenced!"

#DropTheChargesCO

item.title: Joel, Lillian, and Eliza are free! But the battle is far from...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Joel, Lillian, and Eliza are free! But the battle is far from over. Our comrades could still face decades in prison for these false charges.

Charging peaceful protestors with a total of over 33 serious charges collectively is a clear attack against anti-racist political organizing in Denver and Aurora and against the entire Black Lives Matter movement. This retaliatory attack sets a dangerous precedent for all organizers who speak out against the police state and white supremacy if the charges go unchallenged.

TOMORROW - Join us at 12pm at the Capitol Building to show the police, the 17th and 18th district attorneys, and all opponents of justice that they will not succeed in turning back the movement or locking up our comrades! ‚úäüèø ‚úäüèæ ‚úäüèΩ

SAT, SEP 26

#DropTheChargesCO - March and Rally for Arrested Anti-Racist Organizers

Colorado State Capitol

¬∑ DenverCauses ¬∑ 1,037 people

item.title: Powerful words of solidarity from South Africa: "Political...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Powerful words of solidarity from South Africa:

"Political repression in the USA continues against those leading the massive anti-racist protest movement, as seen in the recent arrests of four leaders of the Party for Socialism and Liberation (PSL) and the ongoing criminalization of the protest movement as a whole.

On 17 September, these PSL members who had taken to the streets demanding justice for George Floyd, Elijah McClain and other victims of racist police violence in t...

item.title: Solidarity from UNITE HERE Local 23!
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Solidarity from UNITE HERE Local 23!

UNITE HERE Local 23 is in Aurora, Colorado.

UNITE HERE Local 23 Denver stands in solidarity with the anti-racist organizers who were arrested in Colorado. We demand their immediate freedom and that the ch...arges against them be dropped.

On Sept. 17, several protest leaders were arrested. The organizers now face over 30 bogus charges including ‚Äúkidnapping‚Äù and ‚Äúinciting a riot,‚Äù and potentially years in prison. They were targeted because of their dedicated organizing efforts in recent months to denouncing the police murder of #ElijahMcClain in Aurora, Colorado.

We are concerned that this can happen to any protester. We stand united against this attack on civil liberties and the ongoing movement for Black Lives. #blacklivesmatter

Demands:
1. Free the anti-racist organizers from jail immediately!
2. Drop all the charges!
3. Stop the assault on the movement and on free speech!

See MoreAurora, ColoradoCity ¬∑ United States965,186 people checked in here
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: READ TO THE END FOR EVENT LINK: A little over 4 hours after...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

READ TO THE END FOR EVENT LINK:

A little over 4 hours after their bond was posted, our political prisoners have been released! All power to the people!

Now we continue the fight to #DropTheChargesCO

...

Comrades were there to salute and embrace Lillian, Joel and Eliza the moment they were released! We want to thank everyone who has stepped up in this last week to show support. Over the past seven days, thousands of people have signed the petition, participated in solidarity rallies across the country, added their name to the open letter of support, and made generous donations to their defense.

Authorities grossly violated their legal rights by refusing to bring the three activists up for a bail hearing. But they were finally forced to relent under major legal and political pressure, and now all three are out on bail.

Eliza, Joel and Lillian, along with Russell Ruch, still face outrageously false felony charges that could result in years-long imprisonment. And the cops who ruthlessly murdered Elijah McClain have not been brought to justice. We will continue the fight!

Now the next phase of this struggle begins ‚Äî to get all these unjust and bogus charges completely dropped ‚Äî and we will need all your solidarity, to continue to stand united as a movement.

Here is what you can do to help:

Sign on to the solidarity statement
Sign the petition to drop all the charges!
Donate to the legal and political support campaign for the arrested organizers

Please join us Saturday, Sept. 26 at Noon at the Colorado State Capitol to demand that all charges be dropped against the anti-racist organizers!


https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl

See More

item.title: Adams County Detention Center has now failed to release Joel,...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Adams County Detention Center has now failed to release Joel, Lillian, and Eliza for 4 hours after bond was posted, violating Colorado SB19-191 on Prompt Pretrial Liberty and Fairness. Their campaign against protest leaders continues.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Last night the Party for Socialism and Liberation in Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Last night the Party for Socialism and Liberation in Denver joined with anti-racist organizers and hundreds of community members in the wake of the grand jury's failure to bring charges against officers for the murder of Breonna Taylor. We marched from the Colorado State Capitol to the Bryon Rogers Federal Building to demand more for Breonna!

#NoJusticeNoPeace #JusticeForBreonna

+3
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Breonna Taylor should still be here today, and she would be if...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Breonna Taylor should still be here today, and she would be if the police weren‚Äôt assured by the system in a million different ways that they will get away with wanton murder and racist, sexist violence.

Breonna Taylor was murdered by Louisville, KY, police while asleep in her home in March of this year. Today, the three officers responsible for her death ‚Äî Jonathan Mattingly, Brett Hankison, and Myles Cosgrove ‚Äî were not held responsible for her death. A grand jury indicted only one former...

liberationnews.org

Officers who murdered Breonna Taylor not held accountable

Breonna Taylor was murdered by Louisville, KY, police while asleep in her home in March of this year. Today, the three officers responsible for her death ‚Äî Jonathan Mattingly, Brett Hankison, and Myles Cosgrove ‚Äî were not held responsible for her death. A grand jury indicted only one former...Breonna Taylor was murdered by Louisville, KY, police while asleep in her home in March of this year. item.title: Breonna Taylor was murdered by Louisville, KY police while...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Breonna Taylor was murdered by Louisville, KY police while asleep in her home in March of this year. Today, the three officers responsible for her death ‚Äì Jonathan Mattingly, Brett Hankison, and Myles Cosgrove ‚Äì were not held responsible for her death.

From Louisville to Aurora, killer cops are murdering Black people without facing any consequences for the racist terror and repression that they carry out. The function of the police in a government that is not meant to serve the working and oppressed people in the country is to control and subjugate the most oppressed sectors of society. The only way we can end this system of death and violence is to organize in our communities and to build solidarity among the most oppressed and exploited to fight in unity against white supremacy and police terror. #justiceforbreonnataylor
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: STATEMENTS from political prisoner Joel Northam's family,...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

STATEMENTS from political prisoner Joel Northam's family, who all have Joel's gift for writing and speaking.

"They have messed with the WRONG Black momma. I will fight for my son with everything I have!" - Glynese Northam, Joel's mother

"Daily, this country is becoming a fascist dictatorship. A group of non-violent protestors (one whose name you‚Äôll recognize) were arrested in Denver today. Not peacefully or quietly arrested, but arrested in a bombastic manner intended to inti...midate, strike fear, shut us up. Don‚Äôt you dare shut up. Don‚Äôt you dare be intimidated. Speak up louder, take greater action. Don‚Äôt worry about Joel, let me do that. After all, he‚Äôs proud of himself. His philosophy - ‚Äúif they‚Äôre not trying to arrest you, then you‚Äôre not doing it right!‚Äù
If anger right now is not your first instinct, you need to ask yourself how much you truly care about your fellow human. After all, Joel has been on the front lines all summer fight for justice. He has not been violent, he has not been looting (I know because I had the opportunity to stand right beside him on various occasions and earlier this year most recently). He has been DISRUPTING THE STATUS QUO AND DEMANDING THINGS CHANGE FOR THE BETTERMENT OF ALL. It doesn‚Äôt get more patriotic than that.
I‚Äôm realizing more and more that folks simply do not want change for the betterment of all. No form of protest has been deemed acceptable. They either want change for the betterment of themselves or no change at all." - Joel's brother Adam Northam

"It has been 6 days since my brother in law, Joel‚Äôs arrest, and he still sits in prison. He has been denied due process as there has been no Bond hearing, or any court appearance. His phone calls are being cut off, blocked, and disconnected, and he is only allowed to leave his pod for 40 minutes a day. He has only been given one face mask since arrival, and though there are positive covid cases in the jail, most of the guards aren‚Äôt wearing masks and surfaces and pods are never cleaned. Joel Northam, Lillian House, and Eliza Lucero, are sitting in these conditions, after being arrested in their homes, cars, and in parking lots almost a week ago, because of the work they have been doing to hold the DA, Dave Young, and the Aurora police department accountable for their direct hand in the murder of Elijah McClain. These anti-racism organizers are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up, aimed at stopping and silencing the movement for the justice of Elijah. And in the very first stages of this, the state is already functioning as if they are above the law. These leaders are being targeted in an effort to silence their fight for racial justice, and to intimidate others into silence and submission." - Joel's sister-in-law Lisa Northam

See More

item.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
